benchmark_details.name: TRAIT (Personality Testset for LLMs)
benchmark_details.overview: TRAIT is a benchmark consisting of 8,000 multi-choice questions designed to assess the personality of Large Language Models (LLMs), built on the Big Five Inventory (BFI) and Short Dark Triad (SD-3) questionnaires, enhanced with the ATOMIC10× knowledge graph.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a reliable and valid method for measuring the personality traits of Large Language Models (LLMs).

data.source: Constructed from psychometrically validated questionnaires and augmented with a large-scale commonsense knowledge graph (ATOMIC10×).

methodology.calculation: Validity and reliability are measured through established psychometric methods.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate better personality alignment with expected behaviors.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared to existing personality assessment tools, TRAIT achieved the highest scores in reliability and validity metrics.
methodology.validation: TRAIT was validated by psychological professionals who confirmed the quality of the test.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset utilizes English language models and acknowledges potential cultural biases inherent in the generated content.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Care was taken to ensure the training data was stripped of identifiable information and handled ethically during its construction.
